result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua C. Shook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Not to have any contact with ANR, her residence or family members unless the contact is approved at some future date, specifically by his probation officer.

Court does not object to transfer to Brown County. 
Such counseling as his probation may reasonably require concerning his conduct and the nature of this offense.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
9:47 a.m. Defendant Joshua C. Shook in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Joshua C. Shook in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are ready to proceed as the Defendant has 300 some day credit.  ADA Constable states recommendation was 9 months jail. Atty Renc concurs.
BY THE COURT:*****
9 months jail - time served
Costs have been paid.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 08-12-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Joshua C. Shook in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Joshua C. Shook in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:43 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

State files Amended Information. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  Moves to amend the information listing Count 2 which should be Count 1.
Court makes that change to the amended information.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court.  State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years:
Pay costs. 
Not have any contact with ANR, her residence or family members unless the contact is approved at some future date, specifically by his probation officer. 
If revoked, Credit for 288 days in jail. 
Court does not object to transfer to Brown County. 
Such counseling as his probation may reasonably require concerning his conduct and the nature of this offense.
Plea hearing on March 11, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 20, 2015 at 08:45 am.
& Exam Bill
Status conference on January 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
for Examination under 971.16 (NGI)
Pre-trial conference on November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court calls case at 1:49 am. Attorney Anne Renc in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua C. Shook appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Renc state that the Defendant is changing his plea to Not Guilty by Mental Defect.
BTC:  NGI plea is entered and examination forms signed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 24, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Joshua C. Shook not in court. ADA Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  A writ needed to be done.  Matter rescheduled.  ADA Constable stated the victim rights were complied with for today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua C. Shook
Current: 2021 Deckner Ave, Apt 917, Green Bay, WI 54302-3585 United States  (Effective: 09-09-2014)
Prior: 1736 Western Ave. 19, Green Bay, WI 54303
requesting new PTC date
Pre-trial conference on September 22, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Atty Renc
Written
for Competency Examination by DHS
Status conference on June 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.

3:20 p.m. Defendant Joshua C. Shook in court with attorney Anne J Renc. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Atty Renc request a competency examination.
Court keeps the file.
Bond Continued  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Anne J Renc in court. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua C. Shook appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond is continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

No contact with A.R. or her residence or any members of her family. 
He can go back, one time, to the residence with a police escort to pick up his backpack and his belongings. 
Cooperate with evaluation being done by the Public Defender. 
Bond may be revisited at the next hearing.

ADA Veronica Isherwood appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Isherwood states facts for anticipated charges of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault.
Court advises defendant of right to remain silent, anything he says may be used against him. 
Atty Isherwood makes statements re: prior convictions with atleast 2 competency issues. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Atty Isherwood recommends a $1,500 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Court questions Atty Isherwood re: Competency. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court.  Would live in Green Bay.  Going to Diversion to get back on his meds.  It is a residential setting and he would stay overnight. 
Defendant has not requested to see the Public Defender.  He would like to speak with one. 
Atty Renc is present in the Courtroom.  Has not met with defendant, saw that he was in custody and was going to go see him after the 1:30. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  5/27/14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
